title: Are Cengage books good for JEE Advanced? - Quora

response.answer_text: I personally used Cengage Books and cleared JEE Advanced without any coaching Cengage has solutions for all problems which makes it a good resource Cengage should be highly recommended in certain areas of PCM:- 1)Chemistry Organic Chemistry:-requires in-depth knowledge of all nuances/cases and conditional working of reagents. Cengage has all the cases neatly tabulated due to which you wont need multiple resources.  A particularly useful table in Cengage having various reagents and their action on all functional groups summarized in one place. 2)Math Algebra:-The Arihant method of teaching math involves bombarding you with a lot of solved examples. It helps in certain areas but in topics like Algebra you may find yourself getting lost. Cengage on the other hand has limited solved examples but a method wise approach wherein the problems are divided into cases which i personally found more helpful  Method oriented teaching with few solved examples in topics like sequence and series is more helpful than a bombardment of solved examples which you cannot solve on your own 3)Physics Mechanics and Electrostatics:-A combination of good schematic diagrams and categorization does make topics like rotation easier to grasp.Electrostatics requires a lot of problem solving. Cengage has a good collection of problems. Overall Cengage as a whole is good as a content book and if you want a grasp of the topic but for higher level problems you should refer to Irodov and the 500/1000 problems series of Arihant. Cengage Learning is prominent all over the globe. It does bring the simple lucid approach required for JEE for explaining the trickiest of concepts and is a good resource to start off.

Yes C-engage books are really good for IIT JEE advanced. But not sufficient to get TOP RANKS! if you want to get rank close to 5000 then C engage is sufficient. Now please understand I am here talking about maths book only. To perform even better you would need extra concepts/problems/ tough ….something more. I have made a list of some study material to fulfill that… 1) rank booster questions bank or some fancy title like this by every Coaching Institute of Kota and Delhi and south ( Narayana and Chaitanya). I did at my time brilliant YG file and FIITJEE's GMP. Both had really tough questions. Take advice from your teacher about this because when you bring up doubts from them they will be helping you. 2) test papers ( at centres) or distance learning test papers ( at home under exam Conditions) of various coaching institutes. I did at my time FIITJEE'S RTPF and FIITJEE open…CURRENTLY I would recommend to join ALLEN OR RESONANCE Test series. 3) mock papers immediately before the IIT JEE advanced paper of reputed coaching institutes like Allen Resonance Vibrant are very helpful. You should also go through the study material of Chaina batch of south which I hold in High esteem! 4) institutes also release their question bank of tough questions on JEE advanced…( please take advice of teachers regarding this). My first recommendation would be that take your own coaching institutions material. Then go for any more material/questions. Best regards.

I remember when I was in 12th standard preparing for my jee I first time heard the name of this book from my friend. His physics tutor recommended him this book. So for a day I borrowed the books from him. The book includes Electrostatics. The book has all the theory required in jee advanced in a very effective form. The books has all types of questions ranging from conceptual to subjective type questions. But the problem was that the book has lot of questions and in 12thbI didn't had that much of time because I my coaching syllabus was completed in October mid and I had to cover it up. Then I had to solve all the previous years papers then mock test then boards then again revision so you can understand solving cenange physics would have lost my time. But I had brought all the cengage 12th class physics as well as it's heat and thermo book also. But I only read theory from it solved previous year questions. I also borrowed Chemistry cengage but I found it useless. It contains many reactions, many inorganic reactions which is never asked in jee and never will. Because chemistry of jee main is from mostly NCERT and in advance it is slightly higher which can easily be done if you have done your modules. So if you want to use cengage books I will recommend you to purchase only it's physics ones and also 12th topics one. And if you have enough time you can solve questions otherwise understand it's theory and solve previous years and some subjective questions from it. Hope it helps!!! All the best

The Cengage series of books is by far the most comprehensive guide for JEE preparation that I have seen till date. But remember that it is very vast and you could loose direction in trying to complete it (specially if you want to do each and every problem). I would strongly recommend you to do all the books in this series, but only if you are doing a correspondence course or aren't taking any coaching from one of the big JEE hubs. However if you have joined an institute like FIITJEE or ALLEN, you will be better of concentrating on the packages given by them. In addition to that you should do some challenging books (specially seeing the level of this year's paper). You could do 500 solved problems in Physics by DC Pandey (subjective)Advanced Problems in School Physics (Cengage Series)Similarly refer to its equivalent by SK Goyal for Maths.For Maths it is very important to practice a lot, so do as many questions as you can do (without stressing yourself), dont limit yourself to any book. If possible form a study circle with your friends so that you can get to know the challenging problems of other books like ML Khanna, Amit M Aggarwal, SK Goyal (obj), G Tewani etc. without having to do the entire thing yourself.Hope you have an enjoyable journey preparing for JEE.

Cengage books for JEE Advanced are surely good but the thing is they are completely problem based books. So it's better to first make your basics clear by going for other books(you'll find a lot of them in the market) and then you can start solving Cengage books for JEE Advanced. There are a lot of printing errors too. Concepts aren't explained in the simplest possible way and there's more weightage on numericals.But in Chemistry there are better books like RC Mukherjee(Physical Chemistry), JD Lee(Inorganic a Chemistry)(I have no idea about organic Chem as I haven't learnt it yet :P).Physics, you have HC Verma(the best for fundamentals), Resnick Halliday Krane(another awesome book) and DC Pandey for some nice JEE level problems.Maths, Cengage books are good enough to give you the edge. Books by Amit M Agarwal(for calculus) , SK Goyal(Coordinate Geometry) are also fine.

Markets are piled up with a number of books that guarantee your success in various competitive exams like JEE MAINS/ADVANCED. Cengage books are one of them.I personally has used it during my preparation and found it a great book to get a number of good questions which are just at the right difficulty level as a typical JEE ADVANCED question.Even the solutions at the end are meticulously written so as to make them as understandable as possible. Book also gives plenty of fully solved previous years JEE questions. But I would like to point out that I only used it as a problem book and never as a concept studying book. Concepts should be studied from books other than these. Hope you find this useful.All the best.

Cengage series offers some great study materials for JEE ADVANCE preparations. Books of all the 3 subjects are excellent. These books are mainly written for Jee Adv. Coming to the content first, the books are great and have all the important concepts explained in a very lucid manner with examples. You will find many questions from all the topics. Questions of all types asked in examinations are present in the book. The theory is presented in a student friendly manner. These books also have a archive corner and in the latest editions, dpp's are also provided. To sum up I think that Cengage series books are simply excellent for preparing for Advanced. All the subjects have excellent content and good questions. Hope this helps. Thanks for reading Thanks for A2A.

They are good and simplified .If your teacher’s lecture is not good then it will help you a lot.The contents of the book are as explanatory as a teacher's lecture .In short a better book for maths and physical chemistry than cengage They have high level problems as well as easy problems to let your confidence grow. There are lots of examples, all the problems are solved and explained clearly.Their back assignments are really worth it. They provide you with variety of questions and all the past year questions that have been asked.Also they will provide you with their answers at back. They also have an mobile application for digitalization.

Mathematics is the best. If you sincerely solve it. Trust me!! you will be among top ones in Maths. Physics is not the best,but ok. Physics is also very good. You can expect a score above average easily if you solve it sincerely. Chemistry I won't recommend to use Cengage chemistry books. Cengage chemistry is very time consuming. It is good in the context of beginning chemistry from scratch. And also content and quality of questions is good. But the only problem is that, it includes some parts which is not in the syllabus (especially Organic). The theory which could be simply short is stretched in the book. For solving problems it is pretty good. You will find variety of questions. You can for GRB rather than Cengage for chemistry.

Cengage books are not just books. They are religious scriptures. The books are very strongly recommended by me for IIT-JEE. Go for it and you don't need to do anything else. The material is sufficient in itself from basic to advanced. Go for it! Cheers! Nishant Jindal

Yaa.. Cengage publication is enough for Jee advanced preparation… For jee advanced mathematics follow all part of cengage publication like coordinate geometry, Alegbra, calculus etc.. Follow it thoroughly and try to solve all types of numerical and problems so that u can gain confidence regarding difficulties of jee advanced questions…. For jee advanced physics it is also very good…Solve all numerical and problems… For chemistry jee advanced it is also good…. Maintains consistency and revise problems on daily basis and keep faith on your preparation…You will definitely achieve your goals…. Best of luck…. Thanks….. Hope it helps you a lot…. For more information and query contact m freely or text me……

The contents of the book are as explanatory as a teacher's lecture and they are very similar to the notes provided in coaching centres of Kota (vibrant ,Bansal etc.) In short I haven't seen a better book for maths and physical chemistry than cengage.

Book is really great. Variety and quality problem.Covers all the concept that needed for Jee advance .Different approach for same types of questions.Examples are really nice to solve.Solution is given for all the problems.Theory cover in the book is excellent.Note:- To do all this you really need great time. If you do all this then your rank below 4k assured.

If you have joined coaching , no need to solve cengage.  If you are at coaching and very bright, you may request practice sheets from your faculty and they are best. If you have normal tution , cengage is best in my opinion but please never ignore NCERT.

Yes. They are very very good especially if your teachers are not very good. They have high level problems as well as easy problems to let your confidence grow. There are lots of examples, all problems are solved and explained clearly.

Hi! Actually as per my preference Cengage is a good one for Maths. But for Other subjects, It didn't seem much helpful to me. For Physics use HC Verma, Arihant and For Chemistry OP Tandon, JD Lee, MS Chauhan instead. All The Best.

Truly speaking, If you want to secure the good rank in JEE advanced Dont read 1000 of branded book Just keep these two things as your motive:—> Clear all the concepts. (Nothing else) After learning and clearing the concepts ther will be no question at which you will get confuse.Just solve papers and sheets as much as possible “JUST SOLVE INFINITE PAPERS” there is no shortcuts for success other than practice which is the only way you can touch the success i.e Can Crack IIT-JEEUpvote the solution if it is useful 👍

I think they are more than enough. Since it is relatively new publication therefore there are lots of errors in the books and one should keep confidence and should not always believe the answers given in book. All the best..

No doubt in this that Cengage Mathematics books are very good for IIT-JEE preparation. but for JEE aspirants arihant publication is too gud because cengage will take lot of time as compare to arihant. and u may learn jee level concepts too earlier than cengage so my suggestion is to follow arihant. Best regards, SACHIN GUPTA. Teacher of MATHEMATICS for IIT-JEE.

Cengage books are really good.Text is explained properly.Good no. Of questions. Questions are tough.Do not try it if you are left with one year.Do it from starting year(mostly 11th class).You have to study that book regularly as books are long.But if you have time and determined about your goal this book will surely help you

In one word Yes! But I know about math only. Cengage books contain questions which are actually asked in exams moreover thier solved examples are very good for deep understanding of concept. They also contain questions of both mains and advance (both aspects which are type and level is covered). Moreover they also have solutions to the questions, so that you don't have to get stuck for hours if you don't able to solve one problem If you want to aim high for JEE Advanced then these books are must. Hope it help.

they have done good work; so u must read them, as others are suggesting. I do want to add one thing; read any good book if u want to enjoys the subjects; do tick the lines or questions or explanation u do not understand. And do note down important lines, Concepts, problems or explanation, u come Across. And do discuss with yr peer-group or teachers.

They’re excellent, especially with their huge question bank. They’re good even if you’re doing self study. As a matter of fact, in this year’s JEE Mains and Advanced, many questions were from Cengage. Hope that you’ve got the answer.
yes

CENGAGE publication provide good books especially for physics and maths. As i have used these books personally during my tenure of preparation for JEE advanced. I can confidently recommend it to you. I don’t about the Chemistry provided by CENGAGE publication. Cheers!

When you try to do PhD for a such exam . Jokes apart, but sach me I studied some chapters from cengage but it's just a big name. All such questions can be found in Tata McGraw hill book of jee advance which will be better. It is a huge book. Why take different book for different topics. Use one book and after 2 yr preparation you will know every page of the book if it is a book . Not many.

Yes....for sure they are mind boosters.but when u learn basics and start solving from basic level with patience ,for sure u r going to enjoy it.with my experience im telling u,solve and enjoy working with problems...

Cengage books are very good for JEE preparation. Its theory content is very good for bulding concepts. You have to read the book sincerely and regularly practice mock questions not only of cengage books but give mock test series also. This will give you idea of the level of questions asked in the JEE exam. All the best !!!

There are lots of book available in the market but I suggest you to stick to one as textbook and if you want additional advancement in studies Then reference to topic wise reference books. Textbooks Physics-Resnick ,Halliday Walker Chem-Ncert Maths-M.L Khanna And Cengage learning is good for topic wise learning

For maths i say these are fantastic tools for ur preperation and d thing with phy, i suggest u to consult someone as this depends on your level of imagination if ur good enough to solve problems from H C verma and some frm I E Irodov i say just go for it..
Yeah my better advice please refer those books if u are really studying for advanced
Cengage books for mathematics are very good but i dont think it is sufficientfor question practicing. you would need different materials for questions for mathematics.
This is the best book for jee preparation it covers all the type of form of questions in separate section so if you are preparing from this book than you should go for whole book .
They are not good, they’re the BEST ones you can find in any bookstall! You must finish all the books to crack IIT.
Yes a perfect solve every book of theirs and who know you could be air 1
Yes they provide you with ample no. of questions to pra tice to which detailed solutions are provided

Yes, it is true that Cengage books are good for jee advanced. But I prefer you should go to your coaching study material. If you have not good study material. Then you should go to arihant series of books. Or GRB books.
Yes,if you have your preparation a lot earlier. But really is a good book.
Yes , cengage maths by G tewani is suffiecient for jee adv. I reffered dc pandey for physics.
Not very Good but quite helpful only for PHYSICS. Don’t refer it for Chemistry and Maths.
Yes they're quite good But also read ncerts cover to cover they're must
ya they are good, but u can also go for pearson , & arihant for jee advance as well as jee mains
it is one of the best books for jee advanced..
Can be ok
